Complete the following text with right forms of the verbs given in the box.
get
continue
upgrade
see
read
remain
take
observe
be
start
1st January (a) ___ now as the book festival in Bangladesh. On this day, students (b) ___ in school and madrashas get new text books free of cost. Books (c) ___ the most important teaching aids for the students. If students (d) ___ books in time, their academic progress will be greatly hampered. So, the present government (e) ___ this epoch- making programme., This programme will undoubtedly play a vital role in (f) ___ the standard of education. By getting books on this day, students can start (g) ___ their preparation from the very beginning of the academic year, Guardians of the students also become happy to (h) ___ new books in the hands of their children. questions.uddipok:
Change the sentences according to directions:
(a) Flower cultivation is very profitable now.(Exclamatory)
(b) Many people cultivate flowers for earning money.(Passive)
(c) At present, there is a great demand of flowers.(Interrogative)
(d) Everybody becomes glad to get flowers. (Negative)
(e) In some cases, flowers are more welcoming than any other gift. (Positive)

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) How profitable flower cultivation is now!
(b) Flowers are cultivated by many people for earning money.
(c) Isn't there a great demand of flower at present?
(d) There is nobody but becomes glad to get flowers.
Or, Nobody becomes sad to get flowers.
(e) In some cases, no other gift is so/as welcoming as flowers.

questions.uddipok: Complete the text adding suffixes, prefixes or the both with the root words given in the parenthesis : Mango is a very popular fruit in Bangladesh. This (a) ___ (season) fruit is very tasty and juicy. There are (b) ___ (vary) types of mangoes. Among these, Himshagor and Amropali are (c) ___ (know). Mango is (d) ___ (favour) to most of the people. Actually, there is (e) - (hard) any person who does not like mango. Most of the (f) ___ (ripe) mangoes are sour. But, they become sweet and tasty when they are ripe. Mango cultivation is very (g) ___ (profit) in Bangladesh. But all areas are not (h) ___ (suit) for mango cultivation. It is widely cultivated in Rajshahi, Chapai Nawabgonj and Satkhira districts. Mango farmers (i) ___ (come) very glad when the production is huge. They dream of improving their (j) ___ (economy) condition by selling their mangoes at a good price.

sub_questions.explanation: (a) seasonal; (b) various; (c) well-known; (d) favourite;(e) hardly; (f) unripe; (g) profitable; (h) suitable;(i) become; (j) economical/economic.

questions.uddipok:
Make tag questions with the following statements:
(a) The habit of reading is good, ____ ?
(b) But we hardly find it in us, ____?
(c) Everybody loves a studious student, ____?
(d) We ought to give him books, ____?
(e) Books give us knowledge, ____ ?
(f) To read good books is a choice, ____?
(g) Let us try heart and soul to form this habit, ____ ?

sub_questions.explanation:
(a) The habit of reading is good, isn't it?

(b) But we hardly find it in us, do we?

(c) Everybody loves a studious student, don't they?

(d) We ought to give him books, oughtn't we?

(e) Books give us knowledge, don't they?

(f) To read good books is a choice, isn't it?

(g) Let us try heart and soul to form this habit, shall we?

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Arif/Arifa. You read in Kazirbag School, Noakhali. There is a big library in your school. But the collection of books and sitting arrangements are not satisfactory. Now, write a complaint letter to your Head Master about this matter.

sub_questions.explanation:
To
The Head Master
Kazirbag School, Noakhali.
Subject: Request for Improvement in the Library
Respected Sir/Madam,
I hope this letter finds you in good health and high spirits. I am Arif/Arifa, a student of your esteemed institution. I am writing to bring to your attention the current condition of our school library, which, despite its potential to be a great resource for students, is falling short in certain areas.
The library is indeed spacious and holds a prominent place in our school. However, the collection of books is quite limited and outdated. It does not adequately cater to the diverse academic and extracurricular needs of the students. Additionally, the sitting arrangements in the library are insufficient and not conducive to effective study sessions.
A well-equipped and comfortable library is essential for fostering a culture of reading and learning among students. Therefore, I kindly request that you look into this matter and take the necessary steps to enhance the book collection and improve the seating arrangements.
I am confident that your intervention will greatly benefit the students and contribute positively to our academic environment.
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your kind consideration.
Sincerely,
Arif/Arifa (Student)
